result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Emerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence
May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution for Wal-Mart. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation. To be paid before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No Contact with co-defendant Michael Allen. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Emerson in court with Attorney Katie B. Kegel.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kegel makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

6 MONTHS HUBER     *CONSECUTIVE* 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS   -  Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County -

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:  Co-Def. Michael A.
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $1,496.00 - to Wal-mart  (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00  & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation) 

CONDITION TIME:  90 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions  - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Dated 02/22/17, from Atty Kegel to Judge Carter, requesting to move time of sentencing hearing set for 02/23/17 at 130pm.
Sentencing hearing on February 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Derrick Emerson in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bricco request to proceed to plea hearing and set for separate sentencing hearing. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. Case # 16CF168 is dismissed and read in. Attorney Bricco requests a sentencing hearing after the Defendant completes sentence in Washington County, after February 19. State has no objection. Sentencing hearing set. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Derrick Emerson did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bricco states that the Defendant is not present due to a death in the family. Attorney Bricco states that the Defendant has cases pending in Washington County and would ask to adjourn cases so that the Defendant can pay restitution on those cases. Defendant must also pay up front restitution on Waukesha cases so that the Defendant can take advantage of the State's offer. Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date and will order that the Defendant provide Attorney Bricco with funeral information by close of business on 10/19/16. Court will re-schedule 15CF1554 for jury trial, other cases to follow.   Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant will be excused from status of counsel date, but must appear for any jury status or jury trial. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
